BRANDING | 2015

Camellia Teas

Camellia Teas is a business that provides a service that introduce people Japanese culture.

The challenge

Camellia Teas wanted to maintain the symbolism that existed in the previous logo. Some of the elements were the 3 tea leaves; known as a flag. As well as the overall circular design. The original logo need to be simplified but still maintain the meaning and value of the logo.

The solution

Taking inspiration from traditional Japanese culture. The rebrand is based on Japanese family crests These family crests are often circular with bold and simple designs. The new Camellia Teas logo mimics this.

Exit

INTERACTIVE | MOTION | STRATEGY | 2015

Stop it!

A domestic abuse help app in disguise

The challenge

In order to save the world, there are several problems that must be addressed. The global goals of the world are targets that are meant to motivate and spread awareness about said problems. Gender equality is one of the goals I chose to assist in solving with this app.

The solution

STOP IT! is a help app that is disguised as a stop watch app. This allows its users the advantage of using this app without the abuser finding out and abusing the user. The app is very discreet and will lock into default mode once help is called for. Default mode functions like a regular stop watch app. This precaution ensures that the abuser will not know the true purpose of this app even if they check it out.

Painpoints

These are some of the painpoints that can be adressed:

  • fear of the abuser or potential retribution-victim is very good at hiding abuse
  • perception that services will be unsympathetic or judgmental
  • fear that the victim will not be believed due to the reputation of the abuser
  • victim will feel shame or embarrassment

Goal

Many victims fear their abusive partner will react negatively when they find out that the victim is trying to get help. Therefore, there should be a disguised way to seek help without the abuser finding out.

More about this project

INTERACTIVE | APP DESIGN | STRATEGY | 2015

ParkM

ParkM is an app designed to relieve the stress of finding a parking place for your vehical

The challenge

The solution

ParkM is an app that automatically locates parking spots as the user is driving. The app uses a GPS that guides its users to the wanted destination while simultaneously searching for parking with the radius that users is in. ParkM will detect when the vehicle is stopped and will prompt the user to pay for that certain parking spot. The unique feature of ParkM is its ability to allow users to pay earlier than the initial time stated. This will greatly reduce the cost of parking when users finish their errands and appointments earlier than expected.

    •

Exit

MOTION | FILM | 2015

Carbon Copy

Broadcast Package for the show Carbon Copy.

The challenge

To create a broadcast package that includes an intro, transition and a lower 3rd for a television show. this show must not be preexisting.

The solution

Carbon Copy is a made up television show that tells the story of the desire to recreate a human being from scratch. It is inspired by ancient time alchemy and is based on the idea that humans can be created with very accessible and cheap materials. of course this concept has a very unsettling twist. the intro, transition and lower 3rd all depict this eerie mood that goes along with the creepiness of the concept.

    •
